info.title: Helpdesk API - REST
info.description: API REST del Sistema Helpdesk. Migración de GraphQL a REST con autenticación JWT.

post.description: Creates a new user account with email and password authentication. Automatically generates JWT access token and refresh token. The refresh token is securely stored in an HttpOnly cookie for enhanced security. Upon successful registration, the user receives a verification email and can immediately start using the application.

password.description: Password (minimum 8 characters, must contain letters, numbers, and symbols)

acceptsTerms.description: User must accept terms of service (must be true)

acceptsPrivacyPolicy.description: User must accept privacy policy (must be true)

201.description: User created successfully. Returns authentication tokens and user data. Refresh token is set in HttpOnly cookie named "refresh_token".

Set-Cookie.description: HttpOnly cookie containing refresh token (name: refresh_token, path: /, httpOnly: true, sameSite: lax, maxAge: 43200 minutes)

accessToken.description: JWT access token for API authentication

refreshToken.description: Information message (actual token is in HttpOnly cookie)
refreshToken.example: Refresh token set in httpOnly cookie

expiresIn.description: Access token expiration time in seconds

roleContexts.description: User roles and their associated contexts

message.example: The email field is required. (and 2 more errors)

password: La contraseña debe tener al menos 8 caracteres.
acceptsTerms: Debes aceptar los términos de servicio.

post.description: Authenticates a user using email and password credentials. Generates a new JWT access token and refresh token for the session. The refresh token is securely stored in an HttpOnly cookie. Device information is automatically captured from the request headers for session tracking.

deviceName.description: Optional custom device name (auto-detected if not provided)

rememberMe.description: Keep session active for longer (currently not implemented)

200.description: Login successful. Returns authentication tokens and user data. Refresh token is set in HttpOnly cookie named "refresh_token".

Set-Cookie.description: HttpOnly cookie containing refresh token (name: refresh_token, path: /, httpOnly: true, sameSite: lax, maxAge: 43200 minutes)

accessToken.description: JWT access token for API authentication

refreshToken.description: Information message (actual token is in HttpOnly cookie)
refreshToken.example: Refresh token set in httpOnly cookie

expiresIn.description: Access token expiration time in seconds

roleContexts.description: User roles and their associated contexts

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid credentials or user account is suspended/inactive

post.description: Authenticate user using Google ID token. If the user does not exist, it will be automatically created. NOTE: This endpoint is currently NOT IMPLEMENTED and will return HTTP 501 (Not Implemented). It is planned for a future release.

googleToken.description: Google ID token obtained from Google OAuth flow

501.description: Not Implemented - This feature is not yet available

422.description: Validation error - Invalid input data (when implemented)

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or expired Google token (when implemented)

get.description: Retrieves the current authentication status for the authenticated user. Returns complete user information, active session details, and JWT token metadata. Requires a valid Bearer token in the Authorization header. This endpoint is useful for checking if a user session is still valid and retrieving updated user data.

roleContexts.description: User roles and their associated contexts

currentSession.description: Current active session information (null if session not found)

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid, expired, or missing access token

post.description: Verify user email with token. Public endpoint (no authentication required). Always returns 200 status, check "success" field in response body to determine result.

200.description: Verification result (always returns 200, check success field)

message.example: ¡Email verificado exitosamente! Ya puedes usar todas las funciones del sistema.

post.description: Resend verification email to authenticated user. Rate limited: 3 attempts every 5 minutes. Always returns success message for security (even if already verified).

message.example: Email de verificación enviado correctamente. Revisa tu bandeja de entrada.

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (3 attempts per 5 minutes)

get.description: Get email verification status for authenticated user. Returns verification state, timestamps, and resend availability.
Verify that the API is operational and responding correctly

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of the health check

post.description: Marks the onboarding process as completed for the authenticated user. Sets the onboarding_completed_at timestamp. If onboarding is already completed, returns success without modifications. Email verification is NOT a prerequisite for completing onboarding.

401.description: User not authenticated - Missing or invalid bearer token

post.description: Request a password reset email. Public endpoint (no authentication required). ALWAYS returns 200 success for security - does not reveal if email exists in system.

email.description: Email address to send password reset link

200.description: Reset requested successfully (always returns 200, even if email does not exist)

message.example: Si el email existe en nuestro sistema, recibirás un enlace para resetear tu contraseña.

post.description: Confirm password reset with new password and token/code. Public endpoint (no authentication required). Automatically logs in user and returns session tokens after successful reset.

token.description: Reset token (32 chars) - received via email. Use token OR code, not both.

code.description: Reset code (6 digits) - alternative to token. Use token OR code, not both.

200.description: Password reset successfully - user automatically logged in

422.description: Validation error (invalid format, passwords do not match, etc.)

404.description: Invalid token/code - not found in database

get.description: Validate password reset token and return its status. Public endpoint (no authentication required). Use this before showing the password reset form to verify the token is valid.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Password reset token (32 chars) received via email

200.description: Token status retrieved successfully (always returns 200, check is_valid field)

is_valid.description: Whether the token is valid and not expired

can_reset.description: Whether password can be reset (same as is_valid)

email.description: Email associated with token (null if invalid)

post.description: Generates a new JWT access token and refresh token using a valid refresh token. The refresh token is read from an HttpOnly cookie (recommended for security), or alternatively from the X-Refresh-Token header (for testing in Swagger) or request body. This endpoint implements token rotation: the old refresh token is invalidated and a new one is generated. The new refresh token is automatically set in an HttpOnly cookie.

parameters.name: X-Refresh-Token
parameters.description: Refresh token for testing in Swagger UI. In production, the refresh token should be sent via HttpOnly cookie (automatically handled by browsers). This header takes priority over cookie and body.

requestBody.description: Alternative method to send refresh token (not recommended for production)

refreshToken.description: Refresh token (use only if cookie and header are not available)

200.description: Token refreshed successfully. New access token returned in response body. New refresh token set in HttpOnly cookie.

Set-Cookie.description: HttpOnly cookie containing new refresh token (name: refresh_token, path: /, httpOnly: true, sameSite: strict, secure: true in production, maxAge: 43200 minutes / 30 days)

accessToken.description: New JWT access token for API authentication

expiresIn.description: Access token expiration time in seconds

message.description: Success message explaining that refresh token is in cookie
message.example: Token refreshed successfully. New refresh token set in HttpOnly cookie.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid, expired, or missing refresh token

message.example: Invalid or expired refresh token. Please login again.

get.description: Get all active sessions for authenticated user. Returns all non-revoked refresh tokens ordered by last usage.

isCurrent.description: Whether this is the current session

location.description: GeoIP location data from MaxMind GeoLite2

post.description: Logout from current session or all sessions. Revokes tokens, blacklists access token, and clears the refresh_token cookie.

200.description: Logout successful. Cookie refresh_token is cleared.

delete.description: Revoke a specific session from another device. Blacklists associated access tokens and revokes the refresh token. Cannot revoke the current session.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: UUID of the session to revoke

403.description: Not authorized to revoke this session

404.description: Session not found or already revoked

409.description: Conflict: Cannot revoke the current session. Use logout endpoint instead.

get.description: Returns paginated list of areas for a specific company with optional filtering by is_active status. Includes count of active tickets (status: open, pending, resolved) for each area. Requires JWT authentication and valid company_id parameter.

parameters.name: is_active
parameters.description: Filter by active status (optional, accepts: true, false, 1, 0)

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 15, max: 100)

200.description: Areas list retrieved successfully with pagination

message.example: The company id field is required.

items.example: The company id field is required.
The is_active field must be one of: true, false, 1, 0.

post.description: Creates a new area for the authenticated COMPANY_ADMIN's company. The company_id is automatically extracted from the JWT token. Only COMPANY_ADMIN role can create areas. Area name must be unique within the company.

name.description: Area name (2-100 characters, must be unique within company)

description.example: Equipo de soporte técnico especializado en resolver problemas técnicos
Equipo de soporte técnico especializado en resolver problemas técnicos

403.description: Forbidden (user does not have COMPANY_ADMIN role or invalid company context)

items.example: The name field is required.
The description field must not exceed 500 characters.

put.description: Updates an existing area. Only COMPANY_ADMIN role of the same company can update areas. Supports partial updates (send only fields to update). The area must belong to the authenticated user's company.

description.example: Equipo de soporte técnico especializado en resolver problemas complejos
Equipo de soporte técnico especializado en resolver problemas complejos

403.description: Forbidden (user does not have COMPANY_ADMIN role or area belongs to different company)

message.example: You do not have permission to update this area
The name must be at least 2 characters.

items.example: The name must be at least 2 characters.
The description field must not exceed 500 characters.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an area. Only COMPANY_ADMIN role of the same company can delete areas. Cannot delete an area that has active tickets (status: open, pending, resolved). The area must belong to the authenticated user's company.

400.description: Cannot delete area with active tickets

message.example: Cannot delete area with active tickets

403.description: Forbidden (user does not have COMPANY_ADMIN role or area belongs to different company)

message.example: You do not have permission to delete this area

get.description: Returns a paginated list of active companies with minimal information (id, code, name, logo). Public endpoint without authentication required.
Returns paginated list of companies with extended information for exploration. Includes follow indicators specific to authenticated user. Requires JWT authentication.

parameters.name: followed_by_me
parameters.description: Show only companies followed by the user

get.description: Returns complete company list with all information and calculated fields. Requires HELPDESK_ADMIN or COMPANY_ADMIN role. COMPANY_ADMIN users can only see their own company.

200.description: Complete company list with administrative information

403.description: Forbidden (requires administrator role)

post.description: Creates a new company directly without request process. Only available for users with PLATFORM_ADMIN role. Automatically assigns COMPANY_ADMIN role to the designated administrator user.

settings.description: Additional settings (JSONB). Available settings: areas_enabled (boolean) - Enables/disables the areas feature for ticket management.

403.description: Forbidden (no permission to view this company)

parameters.name: company

requestBody.description: Data to update (all fields are optional)

settings.description: Additional settings (JSONB). Available settings: areas_enabled (boolean) - Enables/disables the areas feature for ticket management.

403.description: Forbidden (no permission to update this company)

403.description: Forbidden - Only company admin can upload logo

403.description: Forbidden - Only company admin can upload favicon

get.description: Returns whether the authenticated COMPANY_ADMIN's company has areas feature enabled. The company ID is automatically extracted from the JWT token.

403.description: Invalid company context (user is not COMPANY_ADMIN)

patch.description: Enables or disables the areas feature for the authenticated COMPANY_ADMIN's company. Updates the company.settings JSONB field. Requires manageAreas permission from CompanyPolicy.

get.summary: List companies followed by authenticated user
get.description: Returns all companies that the authenticated user is following, ordered by most recent follow first. Includes company details and user-specific metrics like ticket count.

200.description: List of companies followed by the authenticated user

get.description: Obtiene el catálogo completo de industrias para selección en formularios. Endpoint público sin autenticación requerida. Opcionalmente incluye conteos de empresas activas por industria.

company_description.example: We are a leading technology solutions company with over 10 years of experience...

post.description: Create a new alert announcement for urgent notifications. Only COMPANY_ADMIN role can create alerts. Company ID is automatically inferred from JWT token. Alerts can be created as DRAFT (default), published immediately (action=publish), or scheduled for future publication (action=schedule). Alert-specific metadata includes urgency (HIGH or CRITICAL only), alert_type (security, system, service, compliance), message, action_required flag, optional action_description (required if action_required=true), started_at datetime, optional ended_at datetime, and optional affected_services array. If action=schedule, a PublishAnnouncementJob is dispatched with calculated delay.

requestBody.description: Alert announcement creation data with security-critical metadata

content.example: We have detected unauthorized access attempts. Please change your password immediately.

metadata.description: Alert-specific metadata object with security and operational details

urgency.description: Urgency level (HIGH or CRITICAL only for alerts)

message.example: Immediate action required: Change your password now

action_required.description: Whether action is required from users (boolean, if true action_description becomes required)

action_description.description: Description of required action (required if action_required=true, max 300 chars)
action_description.example: Navigate to Settings > Security and update your password

ended_at.description: Alert end datetime (ISO8601, optional, must be after started_at)

action.description: Action to perform: draft (default), publish (immediately), or schedule (requires scheduled_for)

scheduled_for.description: ISO8601 datetime for scheduling publication (required if action=schedule, must be at least 5 minutes in future, max 1 year)

message.description: Success message indicating the action performed

data.description: Created alert announcement resource with type=ALERT, status (DRAFT/PUBLISHED/SCHEDULED), full metadata, and timestamps

400.description: Bad request - validation or logic errors

message.example: The title must be at least 5 characters.

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or valid company in JWT

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - validation errors in request data

errors.description: Object with field names as keys and array of error messages as values

title: The title must be at least 5 characters.
metadata.urgency: The metadata.urgency must be HIGH or CRITICAL.

500.description: Internal Server Error - unexpected server error

post.description: Publish an announcement immediately, changing its status to PUBLISHED and setting published_at to current timestamp. Can publish announcements in DRAFT or SCHEDULED status. Cannot publish announcements that are already PUBLISHED or ARCHIVED. User must be the COMPANY_ADMIN who owns the announcement. If announcement was previously SCHEDULED, any queued publication jobs are automatically cancelled by the service.

data.description: Published announcement resource with status=PUBLISHED and current published_at timestamp

400.description: Bad request - invalid state transition

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or does not own announcement

post.description: Schedule an announcement for future publication. Changes status to SCHEDULED and enqueues PublishAnnouncementJob with calculated delay. The scheduled_for datetime must be 5 minutes to 1 year in the future. Can only schedule announcements in DRAFT status. If rescheduling a previously SCHEDULED announcement, the old job is cancelled and new job is enqueued. Automatic job cancellation occurs if announcement is published before scheduled time.

requestBody.description: Schedule data with future publication datetime

scheduled_for.description: ISO8601 datetime for publication (required, must be 5 min - 1 year in future)

message.description: Success message with formatted publication date

data.description: Scheduled announcement resource with status=SCHEDULED and metadata containing scheduled_for

400.description: Bad request - validation or invalid state transition

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or does not own announcement

post.description: Unschedule a SCHEDULED announcement, returning it to DRAFT status. Removes scheduled_for from metadata and cancels any queued PublishAnnouncementJob in Redis. Cannot unschedule announcements that are not SCHEDULED (DRAFT, PUBLISHED, ARCHIVED return 400 errors). Also prevents unscheduling of PUBLISHED announcements (separate validation).

message.example: Announcement unscheduled and returned to draft

data.description: Unscheduled announcement resource with status=DRAFT, published_at=null, and scheduled_for removed from metadata

400.description: Bad request - invalid state transition

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or does not own announcement

post.description: Archive a PUBLISHED announcement, changing its status to ARCHIVED. Only PUBLISHED announcements can be archived (service validation). Preserves published_at timestamp. Archived announcements can be restored to DRAFT status later. Cannot archive DRAFT or SCHEDULED announcements.

data.description: Archived announcement resource with status=ARCHIVED and published_at preserved

400.description: Bad request - invalid state transition

message.description: Error message explaining why announcement cannot be archived

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or does not own announcement

post.description: Restore an ARCHIVED announcement to DRAFT status, clearing published_at timestamp. Only ARCHIVED announcements can be restored (service validation). Preserves original content and metadata (urgency, scheduled dates, etc.). Restored announcements become editable again and can be re-published. Cannot restore DRAFT or PUBLISHED announcements.

200.description: Announcement restored successfully to draft status

data.description: Restored announcement resource with status=DRAFT, published_at=null, and all metadata preserved

400.description: Bad request - invalid state transition

message.description: Error message explaining why announcement cannot be restored

403.description: Forbidden - user lacks COMPANY_ADMIN role or does not own announcement

get.description: Returns paginated list of announcements with role-based visibility. PLATFORM_ADMIN sees all from all companies. COMPANY_ADMIN sees all states from their company. AGENT/USER see only PUBLISHED from followed companies.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search in title and content (max 100 chars)

parameters.name: published_after
parameters.description: Filter announcements published after this date

parameters.name: published_before
parameters.description: Filter announcements published before this date

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Filter by company (UUID, only for PLATFORM_ADMIN)

data.description: Array of announcements

403.description: Forbidden (insufficient permissions)

get.description: Returns a single announcement by ID with role-based visibility. PLATFORM_ADMIN can view any announcement. COMPANY_ADMIN can view any announcement from their company. AGENT/USER can only view PUBLISHED announcements from followed companies.

data.description: Announcement object with full details

403.description: Forbidden (insufficient permissions - user role or company mismatch)

put.description: Update an existing announcement with partial data. Only DRAFT and SCHEDULED announcements can be edited. Published ALERT announcements (via special exception) can only update ended_at field. Supports type-specific metadata fields: MAINTENANCE (urgency, scheduled_start, scheduled_end, is_emergency, affected_services), INCIDENT (resolution_content, affected_services), NEWS (news_type, target_audience, summary, call_to_action), ALERT (urgency, alert_type, message, action_required, action_description, started_at, ended_at, affected_services).

requestBody.description: Announcement update data with type-specific metadata fields (all fields optional)

scheduled_end.description: Scheduled end datetime (MAINTENANCE only, after start)

affected_services.description: List of affected service IDs (array of strings)

metadata.description: Complex metadata object for type-specific fields (NEWS/ALERT)

data.description: Updated announcement object with all fields

400.description: Bad request (validation error or state constraint violation)

403.description: Forbidden (user not COMPANY_ADMIN or company mismatch, or cannot edit published ALERT announcement)

delete.description: Delete an announcement permanently. Only DRAFT or ARCHIVED announcements can be deleted. Published and SCHEDULED announcements cannot be deleted.

400.description: Bad request (cannot delete published or scheduled announcement)

403.description: Forbidden (insufficient permissions - user not COMPANY_ADMIN or company mismatch)

get.description: Returns the metadata schema structure for each announcement type. Only COMPANY_ADMIN and PLATFORM_ADMIN can access this endpoint. Used by frontend to dynamically build forms.

200.description: Schemas for all announcement types (MAINTENANCE, INCIDENT, NEWS, ALERT)

data.description: Schema definitions keyed by announcement type

403.description: Forbidden (insufficient permissions - requires COMPANY_ADMIN or PLATFORM_ADMIN)

get.description: List help center articles with advanced filtering, searching, sorting, and pagination. Visibility rules vary by user role: END_USER sees only PUBLISHED articles from followed companies, COMPANY_ADMIN sees all articles (PUBLISHED + DRAFT) from their company, PLATFORM_ADMIN sees all articles from all companies.

post.description: Create a new incident announcement. Only COMPANY_ADMIN users can create incidents. Company ID is automatically inferred from JWT token. Incidents are created in DRAFT status by default, but can be immediately published or scheduled using the action parameter. Metadata includes urgency level, affected services, incident timestamps (started_at, ended_at), resolution tracking (is_resolved, resolved_at, resolution_content).
